page.title: 04 Maud Heath's Causeway
page.content:
{ Maud Heath}was a widow who lived in Langley Burrell in the Middle Ages. She saved money and when she died the money went to build a causeway, which is a raised footpath, from{Chippenham {Clift to Wick Hill.}It was to help people cross the flooded fields around the River Avon so they could get to Chippenham Market and back again without getting their feet wet.
Under a deed of gift of 1474, land and houses which were then worth about eight pounds a year were given in trust to build and maintain this footpath. The whole footpath, which is four and a half miles long, is still maintained by this five hundred year old charity.
